abstract: Tax policy experts are suspicious of tax holidays, and most experts question the effectiveness of attaching restrictions to such legislation. Many companies find a way around them.
snippet: Tax policy experts are suspicious of tax holidays, and most experts question the effectiveness of attaching restrictions to such legislation. Many companies find a way around them.
lead_paragraph: Large multinationals based in the United States – among them General Electric, Pfizer, Apple and Citigroup – have been hoarding record amounts of cash overseas, mainly because of the 35 percent tax they would have to pay if they brought it back to the United States.

headline.main: A Holiday From Taxes, and Often From the Strings Attached
